description: This seminar examines the African background of African Americans and ties between Africa
and African Americans. It examines the nature of interaction and the role played by
Africans, African culture, and African institutions in the political, economic, cultural
New World. Students explore questions such as to what extent the iconography of Africa so
used to mobilize Africans in disperson, and how effective was the consciousness of Africa
sustained in the New World and finally the contributions of African Americans to Africa.
fullname: Africa and the Americas: The Diaspora Experience
